message.content: cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MED, cs.AI, cs.NEURON - The paper proposes a deep learning approach for segmentation of splenomegaly from multi-modal MRI scans. This involves the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and generative adversarial networks (GANs) to address the challenges of anatomical and spatial variations, intensity variations, and limited labeled data. The paper is likely to be categorized under computer vision (cs.CV) due to the use of CNNs and GANs, machine learning (cs.LG) due to the deep learning approach, medical imaging (cs.MED) due to the focus on MRI scans and segmentation of splenomegaly, artificial intelligence (cs.AI) due to the use of deep learning techniques, and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NEURON) due to the use of neural networks.
